verb.description: Law. To plead a case again.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Acts of Parliament. From re- + plead. Compare Anglo-Norman repleder, repleider (intransitive) to discuss further, to continue pleading, to plead again, to plead (a case) again, Old French replaidoier to bring a counterclaim against, French † replaider to plead (a case) again, to institute a new trial.
